reviews.content: I have had no problem with this provider. They got me in as a new patient on the same day that I called (actually within the hour).  I had a million issues with my pharmacy and they took care of them promptly.  I saw the complaints of the other customers, but Im not sure if your experience was like that since you appear to be out of state.  Here in Florida (and in Pennsylvania) you pay your copay first or you will not be seen. In fact, when you get your paperwork it tells you that.  This has been my experience with every provider here in the last 8 years and in my home state of Pennsylvania.. Also, every provider that I have EVER had in my whole life, in both states make you come back on another visit to get your lab work results UNLESS there is an emergency and you need to seek attention right away as per your results.  And trust me, I have several chronic conditions and see a LOT of doctors.

Dr. Wu is my mother's doctor.  I have taken my mother there several times in the past few years.  We are always needing to wait at least an hour before the getting in to see her.  When she does any blood work she refuses to give you the results unless you come back to her office for another appointment.  Geez I wonder why, maybe so she can bill medicare again for another office visit?  My mother does not drive, so someone has to take her.  I live out of the state so I cannot go.  They will not even tell me if my mother's medication needs to stay the same or needs to be adjusted unless she comes in.  We will be looking for another doctor.

I went to Advance Primary care, which is run by a Chinese physician, by the name of Amanda Wu. for checkup. The appointment time was 11:15 am and after filling out necessary forms, at noon I was told by the front office staff that I need to pay my co-payment first which is only $25.00. I told the staff that the doctor Wanda WU has not even examined yet and why do I have to pay the co-payment first without being examined. The office staff said that they had incidence that the patience do not pay after being examined. I told the office staff that I am paying $398 a month for this insurance and I will not run away and not pay $25.00. I then asked the office staff to call the doctor and when the doctor came she said no no no , co-payment need now. I told the doctor that when you go to the restaurant, you eat first and then pay and I do the same, get service first and then I rendered the payment. And if you do take $25.00 co-payment, which I intend to pay through my credit card, I can always call my credit card provided and file for dispute. She then kept quite and I got disgusted and took my forms that I had filled out and left her office. . I intend to call the state and file a complaint. No wonder this Wanda Wu has terrible reviews so the other patient who has reviewed her are absolutely correct.
